title: Missed optimization with short circuit AND

labels.name: A-LLVM
labels.description: Area: Code generation parts specific to LLVM. Both correctness bugs and optimization-related issues.

labels.name: I-slow
labels.description: Problems and improvements with respect to performance of generated code.

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Consider this code:
```rs
pub fn other(a: i32, b: i32) -> bool {
    let c1 = (a >= 0) & (a <= 10);
    let c2 = (b >= 0) & (b <= 20);

    if c1 & c2 {
        a + 100 != b
    } else {
        true
    }
}

```
This compiles to just:
```asm
example::other:
        mov     al, 1
        ret
```
([Godbolt](https://godbolt.org/z/MGqTvb4ex))
However, changing any of the `&` to `&&` breaks this optimization and a bunch of cmps are generated as well as the addition, which seems unnecessary in this case, because `&`/`&&` shouldn't make any difference as short circuit can't be observed.
```asm
example::other:
        mov     al, 1
        cmp     edi, 10
        ja      .LBB0_3
        cmp     esi, 20
        ja      .LBB0_3
        add     edi, 100
        cmp     edi, esi
        setne   al
.LBB0_3:
        ret
```
([Godbolt](https://godbolt.org/z/e57zEEor3))
This works fine with [Clang](https://godbolt.org/z/Ev9bqrccn)

Doesn't seem like an LLVM issue (to me?). ~~The LLVM IR that Rust emits~~ [The resulting LLVM IR](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=release&edition=2021&gist=29dc248880357f83fc2fae4501fb1da0):
```llvm
define zeroext i1 @test(i32 %a, i32 %b) unnamed_addr #0 {
start:
  %0 = icmp ult i32 %a, 11
  %1 = icmp ult i32 %b, 21
  %_13.0 = select i1 %0, i1 %1, i1 false
  br i1 %_13.0, label %bb4, label %bb6

bb4:                                              ; preds = %start
  %_16 = add nuw nsw i32 %a, 100
  %2 = icmp ne i32 %_16, %b
  br label %bb6

bb6:                                              ; preds = %start, %bb4
  %.0 = phi i1 [ %2, %bb4 ], [ true, %start ]
  ret i1 %.0
}
```
correctly gets optimized to this with `opt -O3 in -S -o out`
```llvm
define zeroext i1 @test(i32 %a, i32 %b) unnamed_addr #0 {
start:
  ret i1 true
}
```
([Godbolt](https://godbolt.org/z/n5jrfa4v8))
